1.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

2.text: How long will ye hunt for words? Consider, and afterwards we will speak.

3.text: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, And are become unclean in your sight?

4.text: Thou that tearest thyself in thine anger, Shall the earth be forsaken for thee? Or shall the rock be removed out of its place?

5.text: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, And the spark of his fire shall not shine.

6.text: The light shall be dark in his tent, And his lamp above him shall be put out.

7.text: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, And his own counsel shall cast him down.

8.text: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, And he walketh upon the toils.

9.text: A gin shall take him by the heel, And a snare shall lay hold on him.

10.text: A noose is hid for him in the ground, And a trap for him in the way.

11.text: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, And shall chase him at his heels.

12.text: His strength shall be hunger-bitten, And calamity shall be ready at his side.

13.text: The members of his body shall be devoured, Yea, the first-born of death shall devour his members.

14.text: He shall be rooted out of his tent where he trusteth; And he shall be brought to the king of terrors.

15.text: There shall dwell in his tent that which is none of his: Brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.

16.text: His roots shall be dried up beneath, And above shall his branch be cut off.

17.text: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, And he shall have no name in the street.

18.text: He shall be driven from light into darkness, And chased out of the world.

19.text: He shall have neither son nor sonâ€™s son among his people, Nor any remaining where he sojourned.

20.text: They that come after shall be astonished at his day, As they that went before were affrighted.

21.text: Surely such are the dwellings of the unrighteous, And this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
